current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the
		  Secretary of the Army to reconsider decisions to inter or honor the memory of a
		  person in a national cemetery, and for other purposes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Alicia Dawn Koehl Respect for National Cemeteries Act

short-title.#text:
Alicia Dawn Koehl Respect for
			 National Cemeteries Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text: Authority to reconsider decisions of Secretary of Veterans Affairs or Secretary of the Army to inter the remains or honor the memory of a person in a national cemetery

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended—
as
; and

text.#text: by redesignating

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: the following new subsections:

text.#text: by inserting after

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the appropriate Federal official may reconsider a decision to—

text.#text: In a case described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or in Arlington National Cemetery; or

text.#text: inter the remains of a person in a cemetery in the

text.#text: honor the memory of a person in a memorial area in a cemetery in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the appropriate Federal official shall provide notice to the deceased person’s next of kin or other person authorized to arrange burial or memorialization of the deceased person of the decision of the appropriate Federal official to disinter the remains of the deceased person or to remove a memorial headstone or marker memorializing the deceased person.

text.#text: In a case described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , if the appropriate Federal official finds, based upon a showing of clear and convincing evidence and after an opportunity for a hearing in a manner prescribed by the appropriate Federal official, that the person had committed a Federal capital crime or a State capital crime but had not been convicted of such crime by reason of such person not being available for trial due to death or flight to avoid prosecution, the appropriate Federal official shall provide notice to the deceased person’s next of kin or other person authorized to arrange burial or memorialization of the deceased person of the decision of the appropriate Federal official to disinter the remains of the deceased person or to remove a memorial headstone or marker memorializing the deceased person.

text.#text: In a case described in

text.#text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to any interment or memorialization conducted by the

header.#text:
Disinterment of
			 remains of Michael LaShawn Anderson from Fort Custer National Cemetery

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall disinter the
			 remains of Michael LaShawn Anderson from Fort Custer National Cemetery.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—

text.#text: The

notify the
			 next-of-kin of record for Michael LaShawn Anderson of the impending
			 disinterment of his remains; and

upon
			 disinterment, relinquish the remains to the next-of-kin of record for Michael
			 LaShawn Anderson or, if the next-of-kin of record for Michael LaShawn Anderson
			 is unavailable, arrange for an appropriate disposition of the remains.
